title: Ticket #2856: add pow function to ClassAds
description:
ClassAds needs to have a pow function so that we can use it in an expression when defining the 'cost' of carving off more than 1 cpu from a partitionable slot.

At some point in the near future we will also want to be able to quantize request_memory etc before we use the value to carve off a dynamic slot.
remarks:
2012-Mar-07 10:59:30 by jfrey:
My comments on the code:

pow():

  • Why add 0.5 to the result in the integer case before casting?
  • In the integer case, you cast one int argument to double, but not the other.
  • We have unintuitive behavior where pow(2, 3) returns an integer, but pow("2", "3") returns a real. Probably not worth worrying about.
  • We try to catch division by zero and make the result Error. For pow(), we're not catching results that are infinity or NaN. Should we?

quantize():

  • I think it's ok to return Error if elements in the list can't be converted to reals.
  • Inconsistency: quantize(0.5,1) evaluates to a real, but quantize(0.5,{1}) evaluates to an integer.
